definition: to expel/to oust/(dialect) to chase after/to try to catch up with
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc

sentences.english: Tom was upsetting the other children, so I showed him the door。
sentences.chinese: 湯姆一直在擾亂別的孩子，我就把他攆了出去。

sentences.english: They bundled him off to the country.
sentences.chinese: 他們匆匆把他攆到鄉下去了。

sentences.english: The owner kicked them out of the restaurant for being loud and disorderly.
sentences.chinese: 他們又吵又鬧，餐館的主人把他們攆了出去。

sentences.english: The drunkard was turned from the bar.
sentences.chinese: 那個醉漢被從酒吧攆了出去。

sentences.english: They turned me out of doors, and chained me up here.
sentences.chinese: 是他們把我攆出了門，用鐵鏈子扣了起來。
他們把那個醉漢攆了出去。

sentences.english: She bundled him off to the countryside.
sentences.chinese: 她匆匆把他攆到鄉下去。

sentences.english: The audience shouted down the unpopular actress off the stage.
sentences.chinese: 觀衆大喝倒彩，將那位不受歡迎的演員攆下了舞臺。

sentences.english: They chucked the stranger out of the room.
sentences.chinese: 他們把這個陌生人從房間裏攆了出去。

sentences.english: The sheepdog rounded up the sheep and drove them through the gate.
sentences.chinese: 牧羊犬把羊攆到了一起，把它們趕過柵門。

definition: roll over on side/turn half over
to reject/to expel/to discard/to exclude/to renounce
(Internet slang) to attack verbally/to publicly criticize/to call out
to take by the arm and assist/to mix/to blend/to dilute/to adulterate
amaranth (genus Amaranthus)/Joseph's coat (Amaranthus tricolor)/Chinese spinach (Amaranth mangostanus)
